item.title: SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son has been planning his comeback
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
A new Financial Times profile of Mayayoshi Son opens with SoftBank CEO seeming to hit bottom, staring at his “ugly” face on Zoom and telling himself, “I have done nothing I can be proud of.” The scene is presented as the prelude to a hoped-for a comeback, with Son largely disappearing from the public eye […]

item.title: Matt Mullenweg calls WP Engine a ‘cancer to WordPress’ and urges community to switch providers
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Automattic CEO and WordPress co-creator Matt Mullenweg unleashed a scathing attack on a rival firm this week, calling WP Engine a “cancer to WordPress.” Mullenweg criticized the company — which has been commercializing the open source WordPress project since 2010 — for profiteering without giving much back, while also disabling key features that make WordPress […]

item.title: Synex founder, once detained at the border with a 80-pound magnet, is building portable MRIs to test glucose
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Synex Medical just raised $21.8 million to build a portable MRI capable of testing glucose and other important molecules without the need to extract blood.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Yup, Jony Ive is working on an AI device startup with OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Jony Ive, the legendary designer who left his full-time role at Apple five years ago, is working on a new startup with OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman. The collaboration was first reported last year, and Ive confirmed it in a New York Times profile about what he’s been up to since leaving Apple. If […]

item.title: Pedego’s Cargo e-bike: Sporty, stylish and powerful for $4,000
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
The Pedego’s Cargo e-bike is marketed as a powerful and sporty ride that’s geared towards parents toting kids around town and anyone who needs to schlep heavy gear.  I spent the summer testing out this cargo e-bike to find out if it met that mission. My take: It’s a stylish ride that can hold plenty […]

item.title: Ibotta’s CEO explains why startups shouldn’t try to time the IPO market
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
The IPO market has not roared back in 2024 as many investors hoped it would — not yet, at least. Elevated interest rates (this week’s 50 bps rate cut notwithstanding) and uncertainty related to the U.S. election have prompted many companies to stay private and wait for better market conditions. But a handful of companies […]

item.title: Linus Torvalds explains why aging Linux developers are a good thing
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Linux's luminary linchpin, Linus Torvalds, says that despite longstanding reports of burnout in the open source software development realm, Linux is as strong as ever.

item.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announces $120M fund for global AI education
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Speaking Saturday at the UN Summit of the Future, Google CEO Sundar Pichai described AI as “the most transformative technology yet” and announced a new fund for AI education and training around the world. Pichai pointed to four broad opportunities he sees for AI and sustainable development: helping people access information in their own language, […]

item.title: X reverses course in Brazil
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
It seems that Elon Musk-owned social network X (formerly Twitter) is backing down from a confrontation with Brazil’s Supreme Court. The New York Times reported on a new court filing in which the company’s lawyers said X had complied with the court’s orders — blocking designated accounts, paying fines, and naming a new formal representative […]

item.title: Amazon says no to remote work
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall
item.description:
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is calling for a full return to office at the start of 2025. For the last 15 months, employees have been expected to work in the office three days per week. Now employees will be expected to be in the office five days a week, with work from home being OK […]

item.title: Qualcomm may be trying to buy Intel
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Chipmaker Qualcomm is trying to buy rival Intel, according to multiple reports. The Wall Street Journal broke the news late Friday that Qualcomm had approached Intel about a takeover. The New York Times subsequently corroborated the story, while adding that no official offer has been made. Even if there is an offer, it’s not clear […]

item.title: India’s Oyo acquires Motel 6 for $525M
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
One of India’s largest startups, budget hotel company Oyo, has reached a deal to acquire G6 Hospitality, which operates Motel 6. Oyo says it will pay Blackstone Real Estate $525 million in an all-cash transaction. The acquisition also includes the Studio 6 extended stay brand and is expected to close in the fourth quarter of […]

item.title: Moksha, the gamified meditation device, makes breath work exercises more engaging
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Moksha’s meditation tool aims to kick traditional breath work exercises to the curb.  As most breathing tools on the market are designed to do, Moksha aims to help train you to breathe longer and deeper, which studies have shown naturally calm you down, relax your muscles, slow your heart rate, and stabilize your blood pressure. The […]

item.title: The EU’s 10 biggest antitrust actions on tech
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
While it's fair to say the EU's antitrust tech enforcement outcomes have varied, one lasting legacy is that some of these major cases served as inspiration for the bloc's Digital Markets Act.
